meanings.sent1: She swoons when she sees blood.
meanings.sent2: He swoons at the sight of needles.
meanings.sent3: The idea of spiders makes her swoon.
meanings.sent4: The intense heat made him swoon like a wilting flower.
meanings.sent5: The overwhelming fear caused her to swoon and collapse.

meanings.definition: A state of sudden and temporary loss of consciousness.
meanings.sent1: After the accident, he experienced a swoon.
meanings.sent2: The heat caused her to have a swoon.
meanings.sent3: His swoon at the party was quite dramatic.
meanings.sent4: The swoon left her feeling disoriented and confused.
meanings.sent5: The sudden swoon worried everyone around.

meanings.definition: To be overwhelmed by a strong emotion.
meanings.sent1: She swoons with joy at the thought of ice cream.
meanings.sent2: He swoons with love whenever he sees her.
meanings.sent3: The romantic movie made her swoon with happiness.
meanings.sent4: His swooning admiration for her was evident to all.
meanings.sent5: The beautiful music made her swoon with delight.
